perturbation.original_text: 7.5. Payment Terms. Each party shall provide the other party with all amounts due under this Agreement for the prior calendar quarter within 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term. Each payment shall be accompanied by a statement detailing the amount of applicable gross revenue received, the calculation of the amount due to the other party and the amount of the payment accompanying such statement. All payments due to either party hereunder shall be made in immediately available U.S. funds, without set-off or counterclaim, free and clear of (and without deduction for or grossed up for, as applicable), any taxes, duties, charges, withholdings, restrictions or conditions of any nature imposed or levied by any governmental taxing or other authority.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.5. Payment Terms. Each party shall provide the other party with all amounts due under this Agreement for the prior calendar quarter within 60 days after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term. Each payment shall be accompanied by a statement detailing the amount of applicable gross revenue received, the calculation of the amount due to the other party and the amount of the payment accompanying such statement. All payments due to either party hereunder shall be made in immediately available U.S. funds, without set-off or counterclaim, free and clear of (and without deduction for or grossed up for, as applicable), any taxes, duties, charges, withholdings, restrictions or conditions of any nature imposed or levied by any governmental taxing or other authority.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from 30 days to 60 days creates a conflict with the later clause regarding interest on late payments, as what constitutes a 'late' payment is now ambiguous. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 7.8. Interest. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at the rate of the lower of (a) 1% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by law.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.8. Interest. All payments not paid within 30 days of the end of the calendar quarter shall not accrue interest. However, if any payment remains outstanding after 90 days from the end of the calendar quarter, interest will accrue from the initial due date at a rate of 2% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is lower.
perturbation.explanation: This edit directly contradicts the new 60-day payment term specified in section 7.5, creating confusion over when interest applies. It also creates a delayed penalty structure which contrasts with the immediate interest in the original term. The altered terms regarding interest accrual introduces potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2. Termination for Cause. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party in the event any material breach of a material term of this Agreement by such other party that remains uncured 30 days in the case of a breach of a payment obligation, or 45 days for all other breaches, after notice of such breach was received by such other party; provided, however that if such breach is not reasonably capable of cure within the applicable cure period, the breaching party shall have an additional 180 days to cure such breach so long as the cure is commenced within the applicable cure period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2. Termination for Cause. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party in the event any material breach of a material term of this Agreement by such other party that remains uncured 90 days in the case of a breach of a payment obligation, or 45 days for all other breaches, after notice of such breach was received by such other party; provided, however that if such breach is not reasonably capable of cure within the applicable cure period, the breaching party shall have an additional 180 days to cure such breach so long as the cure is commenced within the applicable cure period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible.
perturbation.explanation: This edit modifies the cure period for breaches of payment obligations to 90 days. Given that the payment deadline (as modified) is 60 days, and interest only applies after 90 days, it is unclear whether there could ever be a breach of payment obligation that would allow for termination.
